flawed_nl_solution:
The price of the cheaper pair after the discount was $40/2 = $<<40/2=20>>20
The total price of both pairs of shoes $20 + $60 = $<<20+60=80>>80
The final discount was $80/4 = $<<80/4=20>>20
The price he ends up paying was $80 - $20 = <<80-20=56>>56
#### 56

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 60, not 56. This appears to be a minor miscalculation.
